data.title: The Elysian
data.meta_description: The Elysian is an independent comedy theater and 501(c)3 non-profit based in the Elysian Valley of Los Angeles. At the Elysian, we believe all great work comes out of experimentation and we’re far more interested in the artist’s process than their finished product.
data.text:
Playhouse Masterpieces

Neil Campbell and Paul Rust present an improvised play of great artistic importance.

BUY TICKETS

View Event →

REPENTANCE w/ Ahamed Weinberg

A monthly comedy show featuring the best comedians in LA. All proceeds go to the Downtown Women's Center.

Presented by Ahamed Weinberg

Buy Tickets

View Event →

The Return of Draw Egan (SKUNK ROOM)

A screening of the silent western film "The Return of Draw Egan" featuring the music of Ennio Morricone performed live by Montopolis. Comedians Mac Blake and Carlos LaRotta have rewritten the movie in the irreverent and absurdist style typical of their work with Master Pancake Theater. It's a hilarious and rowdy good time!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

*SOLD OUT* EJ Marcus: I Can Show You

EJ Marcus has a lot of fun stuff to show you if you would let him. I Can Show you is an earnest, playful story about being a kid, being an adult and, well, being yourself. Grab your goggles, hold your nose, and let's dive for rings, ok?

Directed by Michelle Chu

This show is SOLD OUT. There will be a standby line at the door 30 min before showtime.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

*SOLD OUT* Yeti or Not!

Yeti or Not, here we come! Improv team Yeti and a highly curated guest team bring you two unique improv sets. Are you Yeti for a good time?

This show is SOLD OUT. There will be a standby line at the door 30 min before showtime.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Funny Games (Show/Open Mic In The Skunk Room)

A hybrid open mic / comedy show! If you put your name in the bucket to perform, the show is FREE!

Hosted by Kate O'Connor, Jo Scott, & Meaghan Strickland

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Playspace (Clown Jam)

A weekly community event to play together, workshop ideas big and small, or come completely unprepared and find something new. It’s FREE!

More Info

View Event →

Fuck This Month (IN PERSON & LIVESTREAMED)

Let’s face it; this month is trash... but we’re here to help! A cast of veteran comedians will take your shitty month and spin them into a fully improvised show. Catharsis through comedy!

Cast: Katie Marovitch, Ify Nwadiwe, Jacob Wysocki, Anna Garcia, Grant O’Brien, Lauren Knutti, Jeff Whitaker

Buy Tickets

View Event →

April Clark LIVE

"Well, you see, I'm working on something new. I'm not sure what it's going to be. It's going to be funny. And I don't think anyone will be life-alteringly injured this time."

- April Clark, on her upcoming show

30 minutes of new and old standup comedy from April Clark (Happy Days, Cheers, Three's Company, etc.) with sets from a few friends (TBA!).

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Lizzy Cooperman: Mostly New Material Girl

A show that lands smack dab between Madonna’s birthday (8/16) and Lizzy’s (8/19) is the perfect excuse for an hour of standup that’s bold and unconventional and might even mention Kabbalah. Lizzy plus her keyboard plus her largely fresh *non-Madonna-themed* material and a VERRRY special guest will keep on pushing your laughs…over the borderline.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Bad Student Film Fest

We all have a project or two we're not exactly proud of. At Bad Student Film Fest, we celebrate our roots. Join us for an evening of nostalgia, hilarity and the cringiest student films you've ever seen. We dust off and showcase old student films & home videos made by people who have - hopefully - improved their craft and now work professionally in the film industry.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Funny HaHa, Funny Queer

A very LGBTQ+ stand up show raising money for GLAAD's Rainbow Election Fund.

Featuring Nico Santos, Guy Branum, Sabrina Jalees, Hayden Johnson, Nori Reed, Irene Tu, Solomon Georgio

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Going Up With SARA SCHAEFER

Sara Schaefer is a critically acclaimed stand up comedian, writer, and artist. Her Comedy Central Stand Up Presents half hour special debuted in November 2019 and she was the co-host of MTV’s late night show Nikki & Sara Live. Sara published her first book, Grand, in 2020 with Simon & Schuster. She has written for numerous television programs including Who Wants To Be a Millionaire, The Mark Twain Prize for American Humor, Would I Lie To You, and The History of Swear Words. She won two Emmy awards for her work at Late Night with Jimmy Fallon. In recent years, Sara’s satirical sketches have been viral hits, including Comedy Ad, Quarantine Barbie, How To Sell a TV Show in 3 Easy Steps, and MeResearch. Sara toured her solo show Going Up in 10 countries in 2023. The New York Times called it "ambitious and nimble” and “a feat of comedy.”

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Whose Line Is It Anywho?

LA's finest long-form improvisers dive into a high-octane homage to everyone's favorite improv TV show. Come witness our very own 'Drew Carey' and see if the points really DO matter!

BUY TICKETS

View Event →

Anointed Greens Presents: Unsung Black Sheroes

Anointed Greens sketch team is taking a moment to honor Black women in pop culture who deserve their flowers, some real, some fictional, all equally important. A mix of sketches will honor R&B legends like Mariah Carey, female friendships, and unsung heroes like Boo Boo The Fool while other ones will call out Drake's new rap lyrics and dads who owe over $2500 in child support and therefore can't get a passport. It's silly, it's biting, and every sketch leaves you with a new fact you didn't know about!

Starring Paige Elson, Dyani Rejae, and April Rock. Directed by Ashleigh Hairston

BUY TICKETS

View Event →

Jordan Show

Jordan Show is a live late night talk show hosted by cultural critic and performer Jordan Coley (The New Yorker, GQ, The Nation, NPR). Each month, Jordan presents a blend of standup, video sketches, and irreverent interviews, pulling guests from a unique cross-section of the music industry, art world, film &tv, and beyond. Past guests include award-winning critic Vinson Cunningham of The New Yorker, filmmaker Alex Huggins (The Curse, Showtime), actor and comedian Sabrina Wu (Verified Stand-Up, Netflix), and musical performances from buzzing independent acts like Chanel Beads, Caleb Giles, and Starchild & The New Romantic. It has been called "very nice" by his mother.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Little Stinkers (SKUNK ROOM)

COME HANG OUT WITH LITTLE STINKERS IN THE SKUNK ROOM AND PROVIDE FEEDBACK TO LOCAL ARTISTS WHILE ENJOYING A CURATED EVENING OF DEVELOPING WORK AND COMEDY.

Featuring: Greg Santos, Dana Moon, Natalie Sullivan, Leonard Smith Jr., music by Nathan Blue, hosted by Haley Hanson and Ari Friedman

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Process

An improv show about the process of producing a play from auditions, to opening night. Peek behind the curtain to see the stage manager, director, and actors bring the script to life. Also there is no script.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Red Bastard: Original Show

After fifteen 5-star reviews, this dangerous, seductive comedy-monster returns to The Elysian to unleash his critically-acclaimed juggernaut. Prepare yourself for a roller-coaster ride of raw conversation, traps/rewards and catch-22’s. “Top-5-shows in the UK”- LIST Mag.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Matt McCarthy’s Video Movie Club (in-person & livestream) (SKUNK ROOM)

Beloved comedian and actor Matt McCarthy shares timeless moments from his personal VHS tape collection.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

The Little Things

Serenity’s a lot of Things, and confused about almost all of them! On a mission to get rid of all of her Things, the little living objects that spark flashbacks of the weird and messed-up people who loved her into being, Serenity finds herself in a one-woman music-and-comedy show where her Things come alive. Oh, and... these Things like to sing.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Stand Up and Clown

Chad Damiani is on a mission to save comedy.

Eight comics are stripped of their prepared material and cheap tricks as they perform in their first-ever clown show. Are they ready to risk it all and follow their dumbest impulses? Or will they crumble under the ruthless comments and constant pressure of the one-and-only Clown Boss?

Come witness the joy of suffering.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Playspace presents! (Skunk Room)

Playspace Presents is a showcase of the silly successes and beautiful mistakes made over the last few months at Playspace's weekly clown jams. Built by a community of clowns the show highlights all the best parts of our worst selves as we give space to explore and celebrate our never ending commitment to play.

More Info

View Event →

Sabrina Jalees and Friends

A night of comedy with Sabrina Jalees & friends!

Featuring Tien Tran, Dylan Adler, and SPECIAL GUEST

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Freak Nature Puppets

Watch the work-in-process of Elysian’s first Company-in-Residence, Freak Nature Puppets, as they develop a new show!

The Company-in-Residence program was built to highlight and champion the spirit of collective/ensemble creation in and around LA, and support early-career collaborators as they create original and nontraditional performance pieces, devised theater, multimedia art, and beyond. By welcoming each group to create within, around, and for our space over the course of many months, we aim to broaden our community of artists, further enliven and diversify our environment, and help each collective achieve tangible artistic and career goals that move their work and aesthetic forward.

Freak Nature Puppets is collective of self-taught puppeteers that came together in 2022 and have been nonstop in their delightful offerings ever since. You may have seen the premiere of their first full-length show, Nosferatu's Sweet 16, in our Spaghetti Festival last November. There is so much we love and admire about this group. We have seen the inspiration and perspiration that leads to their prolific creation of endlessly whimsical puppets, their dedication to honing their skills together as an ensemble, and the ease and generosity with which they bring other curious artists and builders into their fold. The passion and free-spiritedness inside their creative process shines through their work. We’re happy to host Freak Nature, and provide support, mentorship, and resources as they develop a brand new live show.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

House Of Gains

Best friends and workout partners Brennan Lee Mulligan and Lou Wilson have bonded over years of lifting weights and spinning yarns. This commitment to growth is the beating heart of their brand new show, which will see the physically fit duo performing an hour of improv fueled by the audience's own pursuit of gains. Get ready to sweat alongside two DROPOUT stars as they push it to the limit!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Cruel Babes

Somewhere at the intersection of the sacred and the profane, of poetry and dire scatology, of clown and Dada, of community and exile, of fourth walls and no walls at all, lies Cruel Babes. We welcome you to our family play room for laughs, tears, and live-directed anti-theatrical chaos that is at its very least…absolutely not like anything else.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Kevin Krieger: Honest Work

Kevin Gregory Krieger gives you everything in this full hour of high-octane, improvised performance. THIS IS NOT A WORK IN PROGRESS. It is the final product, and the promise is simple: to give you the best show of your entire life – made up right on the spot. No props, no cues, no plans – just a ticking clock and a man willing to do anything to please you.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Humpster Dumpster and the Stories We Tell Ourselves

Humpster Dumpster and the Stories We Tell Ourselves is a collection of sketches that reimagine children’s stories for the adult world. These sketches are for kids who grew up and for adults who stayed young.

Why don't the seven dwarfs have any female friends? What if the big bad wolf looked incredibly sexy as grandma? These are the hard-hitting fairy tale questions that kept Lane Unsworth up at night until she got LA's most darling to come together and act them out for her in this hilarious sketch show.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Making Love With David Magidoff

Turning your bad date stories into musicals since 2017!

Comedian and mushy-hearted Jew, David Magidoff (Dexter: New Blood, The Morning Show) interviews one real person from the audience & one real famous celebrity guest to share one good / bad / psychotic / existential love story, and then David and his friends turn it into a full blown improvised musical!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Joey Z presents Trip Sitter

Trip Sitter is about Joey Z’s experience finding mental peace in cannabis and psychedelics after growing up with bipolar disorder. It features stand up, story telling, experimental music, psychedelic visuals, and an interactive game show. Part of Trip Sitter was derived from Joey’s variety event Glow Show which was nominated for best comedy event in Austin in ‘22 & ‘23 via the Austin Chronicle.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Thee Improvised Musical

Thee Improvised Musical is a FULLY IMPROVISED musical comedy. The acting, the singing, the attempts at dancing... all MADE UP ON THE SPOT, based only on a title from YOU the audience. Starring Blake Rosier, Brendan McCay, Conor Hanney, Courtney Fortner, Ike Flitcraft, Lexi Lewis, Rob Zaleski, Ryan Brookshire, and accompanied by a FULL BAND.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Good Showbiz

Good Showbiz is a celebration of the spirit and vibrant history of Jewish showmanship. Eli Leonard hosts this immersive spectacle of theatrical tradition, embroidered with feats of physicality, musicality, comedy, and stagecraft, culminating in a rarely attempted dramatic monologue. While Good Showbiz is a funny theater show at its core, Leonard will make it abundantly clear in his hour that it is also, quite practically, a business. To be in the Showbiz audience is to participate in the vital work of bringing this show to life, and for this work, all participants will be fairly compensated.

Good Showbiz is now running every Saturday Night at 10 PM at the Elysian this September. Directed by Theodore Bressman (Pam and Tommy, Sausage Party) and featuring Sarah Shtern, and live music from Gustavo Bulgach (Wedding Crashers) & The Good Showbiz Klezmer Band.

Poster Art by Jeffrey Werner & Photography by Maxton Sharif

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Hike Bros

Come hang with 4 Dudes who like to hike and do improv!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

A Shark Ate My Penis: A History of Boys Like Me

After an award-winning Edinburgh Fringe and Hollywood Fringe run, Laser brings his "silly and heartfelt" 5-star solo show to the Elysian for one last run before taking it to Australia! This "ted talk meets solo musical" dives into one man's story learning about the long history of trans guys like him. Meet Alan Hart, the first trans man to get gender-confirming surgery (in 1917); Samuel Bundy, whose legend includes a shark, a prison, and 12 girlfriends; and renowned children’s author JK Rowling, who uses a man’s name for other reasons, probably.

"Injects much needed laughter and joy into this difficult moment for trans people” - BroadwayBaby

"As wonderfully silly as it is heartfelt" - Edfringe 5-star review

Buy Tickets

View Event →

The Doctor

Comedians Leonard Smith Jr. and Dr. Jarad Schwartz will be fielding medical questions posed by both a panel of your favorite Los Angeles comedians but also from you, the audience! The panel of comedians will also serve as judges, ruling this medical advice to be legit or bullsh!t. The judge with the most points at the end will win some truly fabulous prizes!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

And The Award Goes To…

AND THE AWARD GOES TO… is a night of award-winning acceptance speeches from 25+ of LA’s best comedians—and future Emmy winners, probably!

Hosted by Nikki Palumbo (The New Yorker) and Ilana Michelle Rubin (MTV), featuring speeches from Ashley Ray, Chris Renfro, Eric Williams, Fin Argus, Jeffrey Jay, Becky Chicoine & Sam Reece (Girls With Brown Hair), Ryan Barton, Minda Wei, Alli Brown, Caitlin Brodnick, and more TBA

BUY TICKETS

View Event →

Good Showbiz

Good Showbiz is a celebration of the spirit and vibrant history of Jewish showmanship. Eli Leonard hosts this immersive spectacle of theatrical tradition, embroidered with feats of physicality, musicality, comedy, and stagecraft, culminating in a rarely attempted dramatic monologue. While Good Showbiz is a funny theater show at its core, Leonard will make it abundantly clear in his hour that it is also, quite practically, a business. To be in the Showbiz audience is to participate in the vital work of bringing this show to life, and for this work, all participants will be fairly compensated.

Good Showbiz is now running every Saturday Night at 10 PM at the Elysian this September. Directed by Theodore Bressman (Pam and Tommy, Sausage Party) and featuring Sarah Shtern, and live music from Gustavo Bulgach (Wedding Crashers) & The Good Showbiz Klezmer Band.

Poster Art by Jeffrey Werner & Photography by Maxton Sharif

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Penguin in Your Ear

PENGUIN IN YOUR EAR features Eliza Bent’s classic stew of jokes, puns, and uncanny accents. Philosophical stories and anecdotes center on new chapters, academia, relationship status, family, IBS, and America’s favorite narrative: Second Acts. This new, intrepid work lasts a mere 45 minutes because Bent believes “brevity is the Sol Lewitt.” Bent is a former NYC-based playwright turned Chicago stand-up who that Time Out New York once described as "immensely likable." PENGUIN IN YOUR EAR understands that comedy is tragedy plus time. That's Bentertainment!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Little Stinkers (SKUNK ROOM)

COME HANG OUT WITH LITTLE STINKERS IN THE SKUNK ROOM AND PROVIDE FEEDBACK TO LOCAL ARTISTS WHILE ENJOYING A CURATED EVENING OF DEVELOPING WORK AND COMEDY.

Featuring:

Charlie Landsman - music comedy medley 10mins

Ashley Etemadi presenting "M" 20mins

Emily Wrolson & Nette Angelini sketches 20mins

Clowns of color

Ahmed Bharoocha 10mins

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Grace Freud: My Father Has Been Murdered

Grace Freud (The Eric Andre Show, Rick and Morty, Girl God) explores audiences' expectations of truth in comedy by closely examining the veracity of the jokes she's told about her father's death and other family tragedies throughout the last decade on stage. Starting as stand up before becoming something more akin to a documentary being edited live in front of your very eyes, you've never seen anything like MY FATHER HAS BEEN MURDERED.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Kay’s House Party

Live DJ, a night of the best stand-up comedians, games, and more hosted by Kasaun Wilson from The Problem with Jon Stewart on AppleTV+, NBC, etc.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Good Showbiz

Eli Leonard hosts this immersive spectacle of theatrical tradition, embroidered with feats of physicality, musicality, comedy, and stagecraft, culminating in a rarely attempted dramatic monologue. Poster Art by Jeffrey Werner & Photography by Maxton Sharif

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Gavin Matts: Present

Gavin works on a new hour for whoever is in the audience for the duration of the time allotted for this show.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Good Showbiz

Eli Leonard hosts this immersive spectacle of theatrical tradition, embroidered with feats of physicality, musicality, comedy, and stagecraft, culminating in a rarely attempted dramatic monologue. Poster Art by Jeffrey Werner & Photography by Maxton Sharif

Buy Tickets

View Event →

A Terrible Show for Terrible People

TOTAL-SELL OUT: EDINBURGH FESTIVAL FRINGE 2023.

A Terrible Show for Terrible People is a multi-award-winning clown show with only 1 performer and 2 spoken words. It’s Mr. Bean if he was a sexy Asian lady. “it's Benny Hill meets surprisingly friendly sex dungeon; delightful perverted nonsense.” -Fest. Suitable for perverts, feminists and your mom… which are not mutually exclusive.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Marie Faustin: One Night Only

Reeezy returns to LA with a brand new hour where she tackles everything from bugs to breakups and everything in between: laughing, Lasik and running late.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

WITCHES!

This show is a mix of stand up and original comedy songs about Tim Murray’s favorite pop culture WITCHES! Murray is like a gay Bo Burnham, but painted green and doing drag!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Shipping: A Musical

Shipping is a totally historically accurate musical set on Nantucket in the 1840s, back when the whole island was run by Quakers obsessed with killing whales.

With a book by Jen Jackson (Animal Control, Miracle Workers) and Louisa Kellogg (The Onion, Crank Yankers) and music by Brian Heveron-Smith (Fanny, Chris Fleming: Hell), Shipping is a story about inter-species friendship, following your dreams, and fucking over everyone you’ve ever met in the process. It’s also about being in the ocean’s hottest all-whale girl group. It’s even kind of about the horniness of 1800s women and the difficulties of modern male friendship. It’s an hour-long musical featuring LA’s sandiest freaks and it’s gonna be fun!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Shipping: A Musical

It’s an hour-long musical featuring LA’s sandiest freaks and it’s gonna be fun!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

*SOLD OUT* Courtney Pauroso: Gutterplum

Courtney Pauroso's critically-acclaimed hour of 'carnal clowning' returns after a 2 year hiatus.

"Hilarious and unsettling . . . flights of ridiculousness you can't believe you are seeing . . . outrageous and vulgar physicality with jarring notes of sentimentality." - NY Times

"You have to see this show. That's pretty much all you need to know." - The Scotsman

Co-devised by Corey Podell

This show is SOLD OUT. There will be a standby line at the door 30 min before showtime.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Brendan Scannell Goes Long

Brendan Scannell works out an hour of standup and storytelling. Featuring Joel Kim Booster and benefiting wayOUT LA, empowering grassroots organizations to make a lasting, positive impact on LGBTQ+ youth across the nation

https://www.wayout.lgbt/losangeles

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Playspace (Clown Jam)

A weekly community event to play together, workshop ideas big and small, or come completely unprepared and find something new. It’s FREE!

More Info

View Event →

*SOLD OUT* Courtney Pauroso: Vanessa 5000

After sold-out runs at Edinburgh Fringe 2023 and Soho Theater London, Courtney Pauroso — “the ultimate sexy clown” (The Skinny) — returns to LA as sex robot Vanessa 5000.

Directed by Corey Podell

This show is SOLD OUT. There will be a standby line at the door 30 min before showtime.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Funny Games (Show/Open Mic In The Skunk Room)

A hybrid open mic / comedy show! If you put your name in the bucket to perform, the show is FREE!

Hosted by Kate O'Connor, Jo Scott, & Meaghan Strickland

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Twin Flames Show

Hang up and call us now. Get ready for a time-bending, heart-melting cosmic circus. Your transcendent variety show from the celestial ether is taking The Elysian stage. Enjoy a bizarre evening of magic, drag, characters on characters, clown, art, and time-traveling friendship that leaves you wondering if you just fell in love. (You did.) Hosted by beautiful cosmic freaks Emily Maverick & Geri Courtney-Austein.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Tomorrow! w/ Ron Lynch

In its 20th year of lauded late night lunacy! Hosted by Ron Lynch (Bob's Burgers, Corporate, Portlandia) and featuring a rotating roster of top comedians, specialty acts, musicians and performance artists -- It is not to be missed! Every Saturday @ Midnight.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Thee Improvised Musical

Thee Improvised Musical is a FULLY IMPROVISED musical comedy. The acting, the singing, the attempts at dancing... all MADE UP ON THE SPOT, based only on a title from YOU the audience. Starring Blake Rosier, Brendan McCay, Conor Hanney, Courtney Fortner, Ike Flitcraft, Lexi Lewis, Rob Zaleski, Ryan Brookshire, and accompanied by a FULL BAND.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Cry Baby (SKUNK ROOM)

The best comedy show in the universe comes to the Elysian Theater.

Featuring Enor Bishop, Joel Kim Booster, Aparna Nancherla, Jordan Rock, Tarek Ziad

Music by Tony Thames

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Dyketopia

LA! Come laugh at queer comedians, Lee and Kate, while they are in town hosting their delightfully unhinged comedy show with top LA comics, Rachel Scanlon (Two Dykes and a Mic Podcast), and Tien Tran (Jockular Podcast). There will be a hilarious performance by drag artist, Mylique E. Fawcett (Dragged Out), gay games played with the audience, prizes and more. After starting in a backyard in 2021, they've sold-out all their shows and now have a cult-following from coast to coast. Come see what the hype is about!

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Freak Nature Puppets

Watch the work-in-process of Elysian’s first Company-in-Residence, Freak Nature Puppets, as they develop a new show!

The Company-in-Residence program was built to highlight and champion the spirit of collective/ensemble creation in and around LA, and support early-career collaborators as they create original and nontraditional performance pieces, devised theater, multimedia art, and beyond. By welcoming each group to create within, around, and for our space over the course of many months, we aim to broaden our community of artists, further enliven and diversify our environment, and help each collective achieve tangible artistic and career goals that move their work and aesthetic forward.

Freak Nature Puppets is collective of self-taught puppeteers that came together in 2022 and have been nonstop in their delightful offerings ever since. You may have seen the premiere of their first full-length show, Nosferatu's Sweet 16, in our Spaghetti Festival last November. There is so much we love and admire about this group. We have seen the inspiration and perspiration that leads to their prolific creation of endlessly whimsical puppets, their dedication to honing their skills together as an ensemble, and the ease and generosity with which they bring other curious artists and builders into their fold. The passion and free-spiritedness inside their creative process shines through their work. We’re happy to host Freak Nature, and provide support, mentorship, and resources as they develop a brand new live show.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

*SOLD OUT* Freak Nature Puppets

We’re excited to announce our new Company-in-Residence program, built to highlight and champion the spirit of collective/ensemble creation in and around LA. We are thrilled to welcome our first resident company: FREAK NATURE PUPPETS

They are a collective of self-taught puppeteers that came together in 2022 and have been nonstop in their delightful offerings ever since. You may have seen the premiere of their first full-length show, Nosferatu's Sweet 16, in our Spaghetti Festival last November. There is so much we love and admire about this group. We have seen the inspiration and perspiration that leads to their prolific creation of endlessly whimsical puppets, their dedication to honing their skills together as an ensemble, and the ease and generosity with which they bring other curious artists and builders into their fold. The passion and free-spiritedness inside their creative process shines through their work. We’re happy to host Freak Nature, and provide support, mentorship, and resources as they develop a brand new show.

This show is SOLD OUT. There will be a standby line at the door 30 min before showtime.

SOLD OUT

View Event →

Playspace (Clown Jam)

A weekly community event to play together, workshop ideas big and small, or come completely unprepared and find something new. It’s FREE!

More Info

View Event →

HELP YOURSELF with Jeffrey Marsh and Jacob Tobia

Are you a weirdo? Are you a sweetie? Are you a trans-loving middle-aged woman of independent means? Then come on down to HELP YOURSELF, a musical review life advice column come to life. Featuring never-before-seen musical performances from your two favorite bearded ladies – aka Jeffrey Marsh and Jacob Tobia – it’s an evening sure to bring you to tears. From laughter, mostly. But also maybe because you feel moved by nonbinary cuties crooning Dolly Parton and Billie Eilish.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Chad Damiani is on a mission to save comedy.

Eight comics are stripped of their prepared material and cheap tricks as they perform in their first-ever clown show. Are they ready to risk it all and follow their dumbest impulses? Or will they crumble under the ruthless comments and constant pressure of the one-and-only Clown Boss?

Come witness the joy of suffering.

Buy Tickets

View Event →

Funny Games (Show/Open Mic In The Skunk Room)

A hybrid open mic / comedy show! If you put your name in the bucket to perform, the show is FREE!

Hosted by Kate O'Connor, Jo Scott, & Meaghan Strickland

Buy Tickets
